bibl.seg: Martin Revermann (ed.), The Cambridge Companion to Greek Comedy (Cambridge, 2014) pp. 147-167, 4 figg.

In the strongly type-based drama of Menander and his contemporaries, stock characters were married to a relatively circumscribed set of plots in which love and / or paternity were a central element, with the overcoming of personal and social barriers the main concern.
